definition: road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: The editorial thinking of famous men of letters in ancient China manifested Confucian orthodoxy.
sentences.chinese: 古代文化名人的编辑思想体现了中华道统。

sentences.english: People scrupulously abide by filial piety in traditional Chinese family.
sentences.chinese: 在道统的中国家庭里，人们恪守孝道。

sentences.english: The tradition of the Way (Tao) was a very important concept in Confucianism.
sentences.chinese: 道统是儒家学派的重要概念。

definition: founder (of a craft, religious sect etc)
saint/sage/refers to Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3]/the current reigning Emperor
handed down in a direct line from the founder
the distant past/ancient times/antiquity/early historical times
Daoist School of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC), based on the teachings of Laozi or Lao-tze 老子[Lao3 zi3] (c. 500 BC-) and Zhuangzi 庄子 (369-286 BC)
Confucian school, founded by Confucius 孔子[Kong3 zi3] (551-479 BC) and Mencius 孟子[Meng4 zi3] (c. 372-c. 289 BC)
time immemorial/origin of the universe/the world
